block.p: Carol Jeanne Volk and Jules Pierre Leichter are to be married today by Rabbi George Driesen at the Four Seasons Hotel in Washington.

The bride, 38, is to begin this week as a vice consul at the United States Embassy in Tel Aviv. A graduate of the State University at Albany, she received an M.S. in foreign service from Georgetown University and an M.A. in French literature from New York University. She is the daughter of Harriet and Harold Volk of Bayside, Queens.
Carol Jeanne Volk and Jules Pierre Leichter are to be married today by Rabbi George Driesen at the Four Seasons Hotel in Washington.

The bride, 38, is to begin this week as a vice consul at the United States Embassy in Tel Aviv. A graduate of the State University at Albany, she received an M.S. in foreign service from Georgetown University and an M.A. in French literature from New York University. She is the daughter of Harriet and Harold Volk of Bayside, Queens.

The bridegroom, 35, is an economist in the office of the assistant secretary for international affairs at the Treasury Department in Washington. In October, he is to begin a postdoctoral fellowship in economics at Tel Aviv University. He graduated from the University of California at Santa Cruz, from which he received a Ph.D. in international economics. He also received a master's degree in mathematics from the University of California at San Diego. He is the son of Anna Matuella of Rome and Ernest Leichter of Santa Rosa, Calif.
